recipeDescriptionLines.recipeDescriptionLine: Chicken Noodle Soup is a Thai version of soup which is prepared with chicken and vegetable cooked with ginger garlic and coconut milk is added for little sweetness. Noodles are cooked separately and later added to soup.
This is stomach filling meal and is rich in protein that comes from chicken and other nutrients based on the vegetables used.
It is a quick recipe and if you are a vegetarian, you can skip chicken and use only vegetables for the dish.

ingredientList.measurementQuantity: 1 cup boneless, cut into small pieces

procedureSteps.stepDescription: To prepare noodles, In a vessel boil water with salt, 1/4 tsp chilli flakes, 1/2 tsp basil leaves. Once it comes to boil, add noodles and cook till soft (10-15 mins). Drain the water and put the noodles under running cold water. Once all water is drained put 1 tsp of oil over noodles and mix well, so that it doesn't stick. Keep it aside.

Meanwhile, In a separate vessel, heat oil on medium flame. Add ginger and garlic. Fry for 1 minute. Add remaining chilli flakes and fry for 30 secs. Add chicken pieces and salt to it. Fry till chicken is no longer pink. Add vegetables as soon as you cut and add it to chicken. Cover and allow it to cook for about 10 mins.

Add soy sauce, lemon juice, tomato sauce, basil leaves, fry for 1 minute. Then add water. Allow it to boil for 5 minutes. Add coconut milk, boil for 2 mins. Check for salt. Add noodles, cover and cook for 2 minutes. Switch off the stove. Allow it to stand for 7-8 mins before serving.

tips.tipDesc: The ingredients can be adjusted as per your taste. For eg. you can use more or less coconut milk as per your taste.
If you are a vegetarian, you can use your favorite vegetables.
Cut chicken into small pieces, as it cooks faster.
